headline: Chevron's Q2 Free Cash Flow Rises - CVX Stock Looks Cheap
summary: Chevron reported a 15% increase in free cash flow (FCF) quarter-over-quarter (Q/Q), and following the closing of the Hess acquisition, its FCF outlook is now stronger. Assuming Chevron ups its dividend by 4%, CVX could be at least 10% undervalued.

raw.headline: Chevron's Q2 Free Cash Flow Rises - CVX Stock Looks Cheap

headline: It’s a Scorching Hot Summer for Deals on Wall Street. Vacation Can Wait.
summary: Late summer is typically one of the slowest times for dealmakers.  Vacation homes are sitting empty, families are being left in the lurch—and dealmakers are more energized than they have been in years.  The past week alone was the highest-volume week for mergers and acquisitions for U.S. companies since 2021, according to LSEG.
